result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua J. Sirek was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Allowed to serve on home monitor if he qualifies. 
Huber for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow. 

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any jail sentence in 14CF17 & 15CF256.

miscConds.notes:
Pay costs and pay the DNA surcharge. 
If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

Same conditions as 14CF17, excluding the jail condition.  
Provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua J. Sirek

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: and Stipulation to Waive Appearance and Hearing

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joshua J Sirek in court with attorney Anne Renc. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 14CF17, 15CF256, 15CF321

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
State files amended information in 14CF17 which amends Count 1, 15CF256 amending the single count and 15CF321 amending Count 1. 
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.
  Will be requesting a restitution hearing.

Atty Renc received copies of the amended informations in each file and waives their readings. 

Defendant enters a plea of: 
14CF17 (amended) Count 1 - NO CONTEST
14CF17 Count 2 - NO CONTEST

Atty Knaapen indicates that Count 1 would be as Party to the Crime, but is not reflected on the amended information in 14CF17.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CF256 (amended) Count 1 - NO CONTEST
15CF321 (amended) Count 1 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).
Atty Renc makes statements re: the facts. 

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 14CF17 Counts 1 & 2, 15CF256 Count 1, 15CF321 Count 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
15CF321 Count 2 is dismissed and read-in. 

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Renc makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
 They are requesting a restitution hearing in 14CF17.
Atty Knaapen makes additional statements to the Court. 
State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.

BY THE COURT:
14CF17 
180 days jail - STAYED -
Allowed to serve on home monitor if he qualifies.
Huber for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow. 
Placed on probation for 24 months:
Serve 30 days jail. 
Huber for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow. 
Allowed to serve on Home Monitoring if he qualifies for that program after being assessed by the sheriff's department. 
Allowed to set up the time to start through his probation, at times consistent to his ability to work, if can reasonably be done in the next 6 months, otherwise to be served within that time.
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.  At discretion of agent to accept prior AODA assessment and sign releases that will allow the agent to monitor and check compliance. 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Maintain fulltime employment. 
Participate in any other assessment or counseling as recommended.
No contact with Bryan Kaufman. 
Pay restitution as determined after a restitution hearing, joint and several with Justin Zblewski if he is convicted. 
Pay costs. 

Atty Renc makes statements re: ADOA on an OWI case. 

14CF17 Count 2 - 
150 days jail, concurrent with Count 1, - STAYED -
Allowed to serve on home monitor if he qualifies.
Huber for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow. 
Placed on probation for 24 months: 
Same conditions, except for the jail, as in Count 1. 

15CF256 - 
30 days jail, concurrent, - STAYED -
Allowed to serve on home monitor if he qualifies.
Huber for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow. 
Placed on probation for 24 months: 
Same conditions, except for the jail, as in 14CF17. 
Pay costs. 
Provide DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge. 

15CF321 Count 1 - 
30 days jail, consecutive to any jail sentence in 14CF17 & 15CF256, - STAYED -
Allowed to serve on home monitor if he qualifies.
Huber for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow. 
Placed on probation for 24 months, concurrent with 14CF17 & 15CF256:
Same conditions, excluding the jail condition, as in 14CF17.
Pay costs and pay the DNA surcharge. 
Provide DNA sample.  

Court orders a restitution hearing.  Order is printed and provided to the parties.

10:20 a.m. Defendant Joshua J. Sirek in court with attorney Halverson for Anne Renc. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 10:30 am.
$1,000 sig bond set: Comply with conditions of 14CF17.

1:46 p.m. Atty Drengler for Atty Renc. Defendant Joshua J. Sirek not in court. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin. BTC: Bench Warrant - body only.
1:52 p.m. Case recalled.   Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
BTC: $1,000 sig bond set: Comply with conditions of 14CF17.
